27878.name: Localize
27878.description:
Localize Your Figma Designs in Minutes


Let your designs speak for themselves. Effortlessly translate your Figma creations into other languages.


Showcase your designs in front of the largest audience possible. Localize seamlessly integrates with Figma allowing you to amplify your workâ€™s impact by making it accessible to more people and languages.


Unlike run-of-the-mill translators, Localize offers designers an easy and elegant solution that:


  • Takes the hassle out of internationalization (i18n) and localization (l10n) processes
  • Automates and streamlines localization workflows right in the design phase
  • Reduces content translation complexities by eliminating the need for development resources
  • Maximizes ROI by speeding up time to market


Localize empowers you to create globally-inclusive UI and UX designs, expanding the appeal and reach of your work by presenting them in the languages of your target markets.


Localization as easy as 1, 2, 3


  1. Install Plugin. Go to the Community section on Figmaâ€™s website. Select Plugins and use the search functionality to locate Localize. Select Install on the top-right corner of the Localize plugin page.
  2. Connecting to Localize. Once installed, access Localize via the Plugins dropdown.
  3. Enter your API Key. Start a Localize free trial or integrate with your Localize Business plan (or higher) by entering the API key.


I already have a Localize Business plan or higher account:


  1. Install the Localize plugin in Figma.
  2. Open your Figma file.
  3. Hover over Plugins in the toolbar. Select Localize.
  4. Type in your Localize API key. Select Connect.


I donâ€™t have a Localize account yet:


  1. Install the Localize plugin in Figma.
  2. Open your Figma file.
  3. Hover over Plugins in the toolbar. Select Localize.
  4. Click the Start Your Free Trial link on the bottom of the login view.
  5. Create a Localize account and follow the Localize install steps.
  6. Return to Figma and type in your Localize API key. Then, select Connect.


If your organization doesn't have a Business plan or higher, please click to upgrade your plan!


Need help?


For more information and to learn how to install the plugin, visit our Help Docs


Donâ€™t have a Localize account? Try it for free!

28037.name: Replace with Instance
28037.description:
Replace a frame with an instance and copy over the text.


Just select one instance or one component and multiple frames that all share the same layout. Then run the plugin and all frames will be converted to instances. The cool thing is: all texts from the original frame will be copied over to the instance.


Requirement: The instance and the frame should contain the same amount of text-fields.

28341.name: figeleton
28341.description:
figeleton


Generate Skeleton Component from Figma. Use Figma as a source.


Skeleton components generated by this plugin follow the specifications of @figeleton/skeleton.


Options

  • animation: Value of Skeleton animation prop. Preview of the option can be found here
  • Square as: whether to generate a square node on Figma as a circular skeleton or as it(square) is.


Plan

  • Currently, only React is supported, but plan to support HTML soon.
  • Preview Generated Skeleton
28341.release_notes:
CHANGE LOG

2022-02-18
- fix Skeleton component description link

27467.name: Resize from
27467.description:
Resize from is inspired by a feature of other design tools that lets you resize things in different directions (besides from the top-left) simply by typing a dimension followed by the letter: c(enter), l(eft), r(ight), t(op) or b(ottom).


Plans for next stepsâ€¦

  • Keyboard nudge amounts, proportional resizing, moreâ€¦

28153.name: Annotate Instances
28153.description:
1. Select a frame
  2. Run Annotate Instances
  3. Automatically get all the instances inside that frame annotated at the side: name, description, and link to documentation of the original component.

28129.name: FigWordle
28129.description:
A new puzzle is available each day.

Made purely for fun and doesn't aim to 100% replicate the original Wordle. 


It was created for learning purposes â€“ the original creator(s) of Wordle own all applicable rights to the game itself.

28100.name: Component Plus
28100.description:

  • Run Plugin

28176.description:
Typography using the San Francisco font family and the PingFang font family

Set SF Pro Families and PingFang Families to text layer in selected layers.


With default settings, the plugin will automatically select the SF Pro Display or Text font for latin characters base on the font size, and adjust the correct tracking at the same time. You can choose other font families in plugin settings. Each file has its own settings. Just select a group or frame to run this plugin, and all text layers in it will be modified automatically. You can choose whether to enable auto-adjust the SF Pro font tracking.


------------------------------------------

Todo:

  • Support custom fonts

A simple Figma plugin that generates a boilerplate file structure.

28095.name: Swift Colors
28095.description:
Swift Colors is a simple plugin for exporting color tokens to a Swift color theme.


Features


  • Map color tokens in Figma to a type-safe Swift color theme file automatically.


  • Define light and dark mode color behaviour directly from Figma, by organising your color tokens in light and dark mode palettes.


How to use


1. Prepare your file's color tokens

Organise color styles into a light and dark mode color palette in the Color Styles panel. Figma color styles can be organised in groups by prefixing the color style name with the group name.


For example: 

"Light Mode/Buttons/Primary"

"Dark Mode/Buttons/Primary"


If you don't have a dark mode color palette yet, the plugin will use the light mode palette for dark mode too.


2. Export

Export the .swift file to your Xcode project.


3. Use in Xcode

Use your color theme by calling the desired color token name in your code. 


For example:

button.backgroundColor = Buttons.primary


4. See it in action!

If you have defined both a light and dark mode color palette that contains a color style for Buttons.primary, iOS will automatically change between the two variants based on the user's preference.


Why it works


The exported theme file includes an extension on UIColor that automatically adapts to light and dark mode variants based on the current UITraitCollection.

28291.description:
Guideliner is a plugin that creates guidelines to help you design a great layout by applying essential composition rules.

28248.name: Floating
28248.description:
Select any layer and let it float on the canvas.


You don't have to look around for information that needs to be pinned to the top when you're designing with Figma and Figjam.


Tips:

  • Drag the lower right corner of the window to resize the window.
  • Double-click the lower right corner of the window to automatically resize the window to match the content.
  • The floating window is forced to close while other plugins are running, just use the "Previous" command to quickly restore it.
  • The selected layer will be exported as an @2x image and placed in the floating window, you can drag it back into the canvas. Even more useful, you can also drag it into any chat tool or browser.

28273.name: Frame Exporter
28273.description:
Export icons with variants.


  • Customize output filenames.
  • Selection can include frames with and without variants.
  • Handles variants with multiple properties.


Questions or suggestions, email naftali@naftalibeder.com or leave an issue at github.com/naftalibeder/figma-frame-exporter.

28438.name: WhichUI
28438.description: WhichUI let you vote and post your own creation to know which one is the most appropriate for your project.
